channel.title: Javec cannot be recognized as an internal or external command
channel.description:
Ok I have a huge problem :( I was almost done wit my server, but i got to the end part, and was putting my server online (i think) by pressing r when the black screen thing comes. I tried for days, but it kept saying Javec cannot be recognized as an internal or external command. I read god of ililkis thing, but it wouldnt work (i put the path and classpath that he said idk if it was too old or not) so please! tell me the problem (im using pimpscape as my thing)
Whoever answers right, i will make them admin on my new server and forums and maybe a runescape reward (1m real runescape cash?)

item.title: Javec cannot be recognized as an internal or external command
item.dc:creator: @stormcutter stormcutter
item.description:
@stormcutter wrote:

Dude i get wat ur saying but now when i press the run thing, it says starting server on 0.0.0.0 5555 instead of 4397 or watever its suposed to be

Read full topic

item.title: Javec cannot be recognized as an internal or external command
item.dc:creator: @Coldbloodio Coldbloodio
item.description:
@Coldbloodio wrote:

Do you know your real I.P? I think you used 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0 to do your no-ip.

Read full topic
item.source: Javec cannot be recognized as an internal or external command

item.title: Javec cannot be recognized as an internal or external command
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

Don’t use the compile.bat, Use what I told you here:

No need for reward:

Compile.bat:

@echo off title Compile "C:/program files/java/jdk1.6.0_03/bin/javac" *.java pause

Runserver.bat

@echo off title Run Java SimpleGUI pause

Use those for your files, and for compile.bat, replace “jdk1.6.0_03” with the jdk you have. To find out:

  1. Start -> Run
  2. Type: c:/program files/java
  3. The jdk folder in there is the type of java you have. Replace the jdk in the compile.bat with the java folder name.

[hr]

Basically its using two files, one to compile and one to run it. Copy and paste each one of those into a notepad and save Compile.bat as , Compile.bat and save as: All Files, not just *.txt The n the other one as run.bat

Then,
Compile = Compile Server
Run = Run Server

Understand?

Read full topic
item.source: Javec cannot be recognized as an internal or external command

in the complie thing, it wont let me press “R” maybe thats da problem

item.title: Javec cannot be recognized as an internal or external command
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

Thats suppose to happen. That means the server is only and running.

Now the 0.0.0.0:43594 means its running on localhost on port 43594 (the default)

Now you can login with the ip of: localhost or 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0

Good luck

Read full topic

item.title: Javec cannot be recognized as an internal or external command
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

You mean, ‘Jre’

So what you need to do is download Java Jdk.

Search google for Jdk1.6.0_03 download

It should be one of the first ones, I would get you the link but I am too lazy. Sorry
